title: We have so many playable Yordles but only 1 playable Troll and 1 playable Darkin
body:
I hope we get more of their respective races in the future as playable Champions, which would obviously flesh out their respective areas more lorewise which is good for everyone.

It just feels weird to get so many humans and a dozen or so furry gnomes, but we don't really get anything else on that scale. 

Trolls and Demons don't really seem like one off type races like Minotaurs and Armored Bears. They both seem like they have a lot of culture and variance in their race (potentially) compared to all the other seemingly one off races.

replies.body: Agreed. We could use more Trolls.
Only literal ones though
Jax is a troll! lookit his hands and count the fingers....and count trundle's...
{{champion:20}} {{summoner:2}} {{item:3341}} at your service

Never quite understood peoples opinions concerning this...
These champions are the strongest and most powerful individuals of their race, so it doesn't really make sense to send in other representators.
Any other troll, minotaur etc. would just be a weaker version of the champion (potentially mixed with another) and wouldn't really add a lot to the game.

But that's purely my opinion and if you have time to spare I would like to hear why this is an important topic for some guys.

Well I'll ask you this: if there was only one human in League that was noteworthy enough to be a champion, you'd scratch your head a bit wouldn't you? Fantasy races aren't individual tribes with a couple of no-name dudes, they're species with a culture and society. Having one representative for an entire _species_ feels weird, especially considering yordles, a League exclusive fantasy race, has a ton more representatives than the vast majority of other sentient races in the game. There can't be just _one_ note worthy member of each of these fantasy races; that actually makes the world seem super small and kinda uninteresting. 

Plus it's not like they'd just be carbon copies of the other named guy of their species, they can do other things. These races will have a society of their own with their own beliefs and practices, so it's not like they're all pigeonholed in to one thing. If you need an example just look at all the races of WoW, where they have metric crap tons of races, but a bunch of characters in each one, and many of them manage to stand out from the crowd even among their own kind. I mean we can go case by case on this:

- Three of the five remaining Darkin are known to human history in some way, including Aatrox, which means there's at least _two_ Darkin who're important to history and would probably make good characters for exploration and being playable.
- Trundle's the Troll King and he doesn't have any trusted soldiers among his own kind? No rivals? Nothing else notable standing at the apex of Frost Troll society (as primitive as it is)?
- I ask the same question of Volibear as I do Trundle; no Ursine warriors he'd have at his side? No rivals among his people?
- Alistar can't be the only Minotaur who has had any kind of noteworthy history right?
- Skarner, Nami and Fizz are understandable, but there's still room there to have another of their kind show up.

Gameplay and silhouette isn't even as issue because those can change on the whim of the creator. They can have two Brackern and have them incredibly different, I mean look at the Ascended. Look at the Yordles. It just makes more logical sense to have multiple members of a race represented as major characters, if at least one of them _is_ a major character, which is clearly evident given the fact we have champions from those races. For some it makes sense why they're the only ones, like Skarner, Nami and Fizz. For others it doesn't, like Trolls, Darkin or Ursine. If they can make multiple and varied humans, yordles, voidborn and ascendants, then the same should be true for the other races of the League universe.

Hopefully I explained that clearly. Definetly not concisely, because I suck at being concise, but whatever. Message is out there!
On Yordles specifically, I'd say there's so many of them _because_ they're a League-exclusive fantasy species.  They help keep Runetarra distinct from fantasy kitchen sink setting #143.
Basically they're the "hobbit" fantasy race of Runeterra.
I think calling them the "moogle" race is more accurate.

While I'd like to see another troll, there is an issue of gameplay. Trundle is described as being very clever for a troll and even while being clever for a troll his preferred method of fighting is to hit you until you fall down. He does have the interesting element of stealing the strength of others for his own use but he still really just wants to smash your face in. 

So how do you make another troll who isn't clever but has a different gameplay style to Trundle? I'm not saying this is impossible, just pointing out a difficulty here that I'd like to discuss with you on how to overcome it.

Like I said; things are up to the whim of the creator. Considering the variance in weapons and powers available to someone in the Freljord, coupled with the physical capabilities of Frost Trolls, there's certainly avenues of gameplay that can be pursued. How would a troll handle a true ice spear for instance? Perhaps they are of a mystic warband who have reverence to some kind of spiritual beings, and as such can call upon icy magic straight from the land. Perhaps they're a keeper of beasts and call upon animals to help them in a fight, the possibilities are as open as the setting that is the Freljord allows. 

And let's not also pigeonhole trolls as all being dumb aside from Trundle. While yes, Trundle is a clever and intelligent troll, that's not to say he's the only troll who thinks beyond what to smash. Then there's also age and sex to think about; how are trolls at different stages of their lives? Are they particularly rowdy or weak when they're young? Are older trolls more wizened, but their frailty means they're unlikely to lead? How do female trolls stack up to their male counterparts?

Essentially when thinking about how to explore a fantasy race to a greater extent, you should consider the following:

- Culture
- Biology
- Environment
- Accessible powers
- Race relations
- External influences

If you build up on these things even to a small degree it'll lend to having differentiation right out of the gate. From there these things inform each other; more racial representatives means a greater perspective on this avenue of their culture, which intern strengthens the foundation for further characters.

The thing with another troll is that it just doesn't make sense to add another troll champ from a creative perspective(as in character creation).

Every champion has something that makes them thematically unique in some way,karthus is a lich,azir is a sand-mage/ra-expy/emporer,lee sin is a monk,etc. and there are barely any champs where 2 have the same archetypes(the only ones where I'd say that would be the case are the kinkou trio who are all ninja,but even then you could make a point about them being a regular ninja,a kunoichi and a lightning master)
However Trundles most outstanding characteristic is being a troll.
Aside from that he also has his "king"-identity(he is really the only king in the game,the other leader figures have other titles) and is a brute with a club,but those identities are rather weak(trundle doesn't look like a king and there are other brutish champs in the game as well).
So if another troll got into the game then that would kind of devalue trundle,it would make trundle less unique.


Thats pretty much also the reason why they wanted to make Ao shin,a chinese dragon instead of a european dragon,because they wanted to avoid similarities with shyvana.

The thing is if the thematic overlap was really an issue then we wouldn't have so many bloody champions with ice themed abilities, in fact we wouldn't have champions with an overlap in thematic whatsoever. The point I'm trying to make with this is that from a world building perspective having more than just one notable individual in a race makes logical sense, and that in terms of thematic, silhouette, gameplay and lore, that's all up to the creator; another troll could be so distanced from Trundle that they don't devalue one another, because they are so different despite being of the same kind of people that they don't step on each other's toes.

I mean if I go in to the Dota 2 camp for a second then we can see Axe, Warlock and Disruptor, who are members of the the same race (The Oglodi) but don't crowd the thematic space by being of similar physical dispositions. I mean hell, Warlock looks nothing like an Oglodi but he still is one. 

I'm a firm believer that Riot can and should include more members of its already existing fantasy races, and I firmly _disagree_ that having multiple champions from one specific race crowds out the thematic that another champion brings. If those champions do end up becoming inferior then the original who only had "I am the troll" or "I am the armoured bear" should be built upon further, to solidify more than just that singular element. Trundle's a troll and he has his ice powers. Volibear is an armoured bear and he has his lightning powers. Alistar's a minotaur and a wall of meat. If them being the troll, bear or bull is all they have, then that secondary element there should be beefed up a bit.

Why they won't just focus on trundles ice powers to make place for a new troll?Well you pretty much answered this question yourself already,because ice powers aren't unique,since many freljord champs have them already(the same goes for volibear and lightning and alistar and being a wall of meat).
Thats why every ice champion isn't just defined by being an ice user(ashe is the archer of the game,braum a strongman/shieldguard,Lissandra pretty much plays the archetype of an ice queen,Sejuani is a savage rider,anivia is a phoenix and nunu has a yeti at his side)
If anything I'd say they could focus more on Trundles identity as a king,or maybe his brutishness(because well in the end he is the only club-using brute of the game).
Another possibility would be to make a troll champ who is just so different from regular trolls that he fullfills a whole different niche(like a small and weak troll who comes off more as a goblin than a troll),might not be the best solution but riot still has quite some artistic freedom when it comes to trolls.

Alistar and Volibear have it most likely even worse than trundle since their species leaves less freedom in terms of variation and they seem to be even more lacking in terms of unique secondary elements(alistar is a former slave and arena fighter,but the same goes for xerath and xin respectively and volibear is a seer,but that also goes for malzahar),heck Alistars title even is "the minotaur".
I would like to see a Darkin Champion for each role on SR, Top, Jungle, Mid, ADC, and Support
I thought the rest of {{champion:12}}'s race was killed or something by Noxians, but I might be getting lore mixed up

Alistar's species (the Minotaurs) have been attacked by Noxians in the past, but their current status right now is unknown. Alistar only ever mentioned them in the lore once back in the JoJ, and kept details on the down low, but assured folks that they were doing ok.

If you're thinking of the Darkin, which is Aatrox's species, they are currently five in number, with three of the five being known to human history in some way. Aatrox is part of the three in this.

Thank you very much for the insight
---
I think the main problem with your idea is that currently most champions are defined by one quality.
Caitlyn is THE Sniper, Lee is THE Blind Monk... 
These champions can be yordle or human because their race doesn't matter, as their defining qualities are represented by their skills, attire and attitude.


But Alistar is THE minotaur !
As long as those champions only defining quality is to be part of their race you simply can't introduce a new part of their society.
First you need to redefine those champions and then you can introduce new ones.

The Institute of War is no longer canon, it hasn't been for almost 3 years. You have to clear this mentality out of your head.

The IoW is not existing, they are no longer representatives of anything, nor do they fight for a reason in the Summoners Rift. So far all the lore retcons that have been releashed, fleshed out the backstory and the universe, and didn't tie the individual champions under any pretext with Summoners Rift. They just exist as parts of the universe of Runeterra. That means they can be introduced and explored, since they are not novelty products, but parts of a universe.

Since there's nothing that requires them to be part of some conflict taking sides and stuff, they are just roster in a game of 5v5. Nothing more, nothing less. For as long as there's no lore about it, this is how things are.

#Uh......No he wasn't.

He was released during_ season 3._  We only had 9 champions that year, which was nothing compared to the near **2 per month solid ** schedule of _Season 2_. Season 2 saw 20 champions released.

Also don't forget he was a brand new Champion Concept

#Light Fighter

**The first of his kind.** What was the 2nd Light Fighter? **Yasuo**. With rework Fiora also becoming a light fighter (although Tryndamere, a much older champ could also be considered one). Now Yas and Fiora are BOTH Fighter/Assassins.  Aatrox is a sustain fighter, and needs to be built tanky otherwise he will just get instantly deleted. He has low base HP/armor and per level. You can't build him straight damage like Tryndamere or Yas. He has insane attack speed, which would benefit from a little crit but crit is a real luxury for him. The only crit I ever built on him was Ghostblade , which was also good because you could use the active after respawning (and respawning makes you LOSE all your Passive Attack speed -which means losing a LOT of damage). But now Ghostblade doesnt have the crit anymore.

I feel they can just buff his defensive stats basically, and move him from Light Fighter to straight Fighter/Tank. There's some argument about whether his passive should be replaced, and with what since it takes up a substantial part of his ability "budget". If they do keep it, I feel he should only lose half of his red bar rather than dropping the whole thing. I also feel if you want to play up the "inspiring" part of his lore (and yes, many on reveal thought he would have some kind of buff aura) you can add a a team fight aura to his ult.

Yeah I got a fact wrong, its been awhile since he was released but honestly he still feels pretty rushed and I'm speaking as a main of his.

He doesn't scale with Crit in the slightest and was never designed to, and he can't fit it onto his builds without being useless in fights (moreso than he already is normally)

His kit conceptually seems to be about being a late game teamfighter, but he has no real ability to teamfight without getting bursted and he only really wins games by cheesing people early with his R base damage. 

{{champion:92}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:80}} {{champion:62}}  existed way before Aatrox did, they are all light fighters

You can't buff anything on him because it will just make him broken again. His kit is incredibly flawed. Back when he was broken all they nerfed was his Well AS early game and the damage on his E, and it tanked his winrate and playrate massively. Statcheck champions, which is all Aatrox is, either crush everything or do nothing special all game. There is no real reason to ever pick Aatrox over any other Light Fighter unless he is broken. Everything that all the other light fighters do, he does but not as well. \

**You can't honestly believe his kit concept is "brand new" can you?** 

His W is a fusion of old Sion's E and the plethora of 3 hit AA proc moves that other light fighters have. His Q in concept is just Jarvan's QE combo on one button. His R is a steroid ultimate with an AoE nuke component, and when it was first released on the PBE it was a heal that increased his max HP for the duration. His passive is just an inverse Tryndamere passive. 

They tried to make a drain tank work, but considering the designer that made him also made pre-rework Rengar and no longer works for riot, it's no wonder his kit is flawed in more ways than one.

The only real way I can see them justifying increasing his base stats without breaking him and making him even more oppressive early in certain matchups would be reducing how strong his heal is vs Minions and increasing its strength vs Champions, and even then he would still be cheesy as fuck early by design. No amount of number changes would change that about his current kit.

He needs a rework that at bare minimum replaces his passive and ultimate. They need to decide what he is supposed to do and what he isn't supposed to do. He doesn't do anything they intended him to do. They intended a late game character, he sucks late. They intended a light fighter, he builds primarily tanky. They intended a duelist, he either bursts people done quickly with cheese or gets fucked. 

Auras are bad design, especially a team-wide one. You would have to remove all of the damage parts of his R, and the AS/Range portion, to make it balanced.
